channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2023100449
item.description:
Report E-2023100449

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: OWOSSO
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio Express
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Upon arrival at the customer delivery location, the tote was discovered to have small crack in the top corner. Very little product was released. A hazmat contractor was called to the scene to transfer the contents into a new tote container. The customer accepted the delivery of the tote. The packaging specs were not able to be obtained as the container was delivered.

item.title: Report E-2023100148
item.description:
Report E-2023100148

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSG experienced a UN3103 TBPB release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors for containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to the box only due to the vented cap releasing as a result of load shift. The jugs were removed from the impacted box and wiped down for shipment on. The impacted cardboard was neutralized with water and containerized along with the impacted rags and PPE into a vented 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Cap was loose on one bottle of ethanol, causing the contents to leak out. The package was placed in a bin and taken to QA for inspection when damage was discovered. DescribePack: 1 loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a bin and taken to QA for inspection when damage was discovered.

item.title: Report E-2023100004
item.description:
Report E-2023100004

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-12T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor and terminal floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to damaged valve assembly causing the release of material. Enviroserve personnel transferred the remaining material in the damaged 330-gallon metal tote to eight 55-gallon metal drums. Enviroserve personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and collected the spent material and placed into one of the 55-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023080404
item.description:
Report X-2023080404

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: PONTIAC
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Grand Trunk Western Railroad Incorporated
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 1st, 2023, FRA Hazmat Inspector observed a possible vapor leak coming from UTLX 679774. The FRA notified the CN Dangerous Goods Officer. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer responded and observed an audible vapor leak from the manway. An attempt was made to check for loose bolts but all manway bolts were secured tightly. All notifications were made. The CN Dangerous goods Officer vented the car and opened the manway and observed damage to gasket. Gasket appeared to be over compressed and had an obvious tear where the observed leak was. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer replaced the manway gasket with a new gasket. The manway was resecured. The railcar was released onto destination.
